title: WTO MC12 Agenda: Too Much or Not Enough?
description: The relevance of the WTO as the primary trade governance institution depends on the outcomes at the 12th Ministerial Conference. A new CQ from the Scholl Chair explores.

title: The Evening: Infrastructure Signed, Virtual China Summit, Night Train, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Infrastructure Signed, Virtual China Summit, Night Train, and More.

title: Supporting Democratic Transitions Deserves a Prominent Role in Upcoming Summit for Democracy
description: With the upcoming Summit for Democracy, U.S. policymakers should rethink how to best support democratic transitions in light of backsliding in Sudan, Tunisia, and Myanmar.

title: Rotten Easter Eggs
description: In this week's column, the Scholl Chair analyzes the pending reconciliation bill and its Easter eggs in the energy and climate sections.

title: China: The Civil-Military Challenge: Volume One of a Graphic Net Assessment
description: China's integration of its civil and military capabilities will shape its competition with the United States and other states, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: The Battle for Coal at COP26
description: Coal was center stage at COP26, and the disagreements over coal reveal the emerging fault lines as the world tries to reach net-zero emissions.

title: Readiness for Open Systems: How Prepared Are the Pentagon and the Defense Industry to Coordinate?
description: This paper presents a framework for evaluating DOD’s readiness for Modular Open Systems Approaches (MOSA) as it aims to transition how it acquires new technology by relying on open standards and interfaces to increase competition and simplify technology integration.

title: Dr. Richard Brennan, WHO Emergency Operations: The “Delicate Dance” with the Taliban
description: Dr. Richard Brennan, WHO Emergency Operations, sat down this week with Steve and Professor Leonard Rubenstein, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.

title: The United States’ Offshore Wind Industrial Strategy
description: The United States is looking to build a domestic offshore wind industry to produce zero-carbon power and create new economic opportunity. The country hopes to build 30 gigawatts by 2030 and create 44,000 jobs in a domestic supply chain.

title: Nervous Energy: China Targets New Indonesian, Malaysian Drilling
description: Over the past four months, China has sent coastguard, maritime militia, and survey ships to contest new Indonesian and Malaysian drilling in the South China Sea. Satellite imagery and AIS data reveal a series of close encounters in an ongoing standoff.

title: Can You Drive a Stake through the Heart of Spyware?
description: The demand for spyware continues to grow as networked digital technologies are incorporated into human life. This commentary explores what is needed to thwart the use of spyware.

title: Adapting Covid-19 Innovations to Accelerate Progress toward Meeting Global Tuberculosis Goals
description: In a new issue brief from the CSIS GHPC, Senior Fellow and Director of Immunizations and Health Systems Resilience Katherine E. Bliss examines the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on meeting global TB goals and the innovations that may accelerate progress toward ending TB.
